EMPLOYEE ACCESS CENTER

Leveling Up!

DCPS has improved MCAP state ranking in grades 3-5 in ELA and Math, as well as 6-8 ELA based on 2025 proficiency.

#DCPS23NoMore

33% of our high schools students are actively enrolled in CTE courses for the 2025-2026 school year across 17 programs.

#CollegeAndCareer

In partnership with Chesapeake College, we have 115 students participating in dual enrollment first semester, taking 28 courses.

Check Us Out

DCPS had two schools gain an additional star on the MD Report Card rating in the 2025 school year.

DORCHESTER COUNTY PUBLIC SCHOOLSNEWSNOTICE OF BOARD OF EDUCATION MEETING
NOTICE OF BOARD OF EDUCATION MEETING

DCPS

November 14, 2025

DATE: Thursday, November 20, 2025

TIME: 5:00 p.m.

PLACE: The Board Room

Central Office of the Board of Education

700 Glasgow Street

Cambridge, MD 21613

The Board of Education of Dorchester County will conduct an Open Session at the date, time, and location indicated above to address business as indicated on the agenda. After the start of the Open session, the Board will meet in Closed in accordance with Section 3-305 of the General Provisions of the Annotated Code of Maryland to discuss personnel and update on legal issues. At the conclusion of the Closed Session, the Board will reconvene at 6:00 p.m. in the Open Regular Session.

The agenda and related documents can be accessed online via BoardDocs on the Dorchester County Public Schools website at www.dcps.k12.md.us.

Anyone who would like to submit public comments electronically, to be included in the minutes, can email comments@dcpsmd.org by 4:00 p.m., Wednesday, November 19, 2025.

Cambridge, Maryland 21613

UPCOMING BOARD OF EDUCATION WORK SESSION

Caroline Schools

November 12, 2025

The Caroline County Board of Education will hold their monthly work session on Tuesday, November 18, 2025. The public portion of the meeting will begin at 8:30 a.m. when the Board convenes in public session. The public may attend in person or view the meeting via livestream. The public may attend in person or view the meeting via¬†livestream.

Following the public session, the board will meet in closed session pursuant to the State Government article (Section 3-305 (1,)) (1) to discuss the appointment, employment, assignment, promotion, discipline, demotion, compensation, removal, resignation, or performance evaluation of appointees, employees, or officials over whom this public body has jurisdiction; any other personnel matter that affects one or more specific individuals; to discuss the superintendent's contract.

For more information about the Board of Education, please visit the¬†website page.

LATEST QUEEN ANNE'S COUNTY NEWS
Celebrating Culture and Community: Sudlersville Middle School Honors Hispanic American Heritage

SMS proudly hosted its 12th Annual Hispanic American Heritage Night, an evening filled with culture, food, music, dance, art, and heartfelt performances.

ArtScene | the Podcast Celebrates Church Hill Elementary Music Teacher Heather Efland

On 11/1, host Michael Bell visited with Heather Efland, music teacher at CHES & 2019 QAC Teacher of the Year.

Read & Lead Grant Funds Literacy Professional Development for QACPS Educators

Funding from the Maryland Read & Lead Grant recently supported 2 literacy-focused professional development opportunities for QACPS educators.

5th Annual QACPS Faculty Art Show Draws Record Crowds and Celebrates Teachers as Artists

The 5th Annual QACPS Faculty Art Show was a tremendous success, with an incredibly well-attended opening night on 10/10 at the QAC Centre for the Arts in Centreville.

U.S. Department of Education Office of Inspector General Fraud Reporting Hotline

The OIG Hotline is available for anyone who knows of or suspects fraud, waste, abuse, mismanagement, or violations of laws and regulations involving U.S. Department of Education funds or programs. This includes allegations of suspected wrongdoing by Department employees, contractors, grantees, schools and school officials, persons in positions of trust involving Department funds or programs, collection agencies, recipients of student financial assistance, or lending institutions. OIG hotline: https://oig.ed.gov/oig-hotline
